aws.api_command: aws deploy list-applications --query 'applications' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read app; do [ -n "$app" ] && aws deploy list-deployment-groups --application-name "$app" --region $AWS_REGION --query 'length(deploymentGroups)' --output text 2>/dev/null || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

aws ecs list-clusters --query 'clusterArns' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read cluster; do [ -n "$cluster" ] && aws ecs list-container-instances --cluster "$cluster" --region "$AWS_REGION" --query 'length(containerInstanceArns)' --output text || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

for r in $(aws ec2 describe-regions --query 'Regions[].RegionName' --output text); do aws eks list-clusters --region $r --query 'clusters[]' --output text 2>/dev/null | tr '\t' '\n' | while read cluster; do [ -n "$cluster" ] && aws eks list-addons --cluster-name "$cluster" --region $r --query 'addons[]' --output text 2>/dev/null | tr '\t' '\n' | grep -vE '^(coredns|kube-proxy|vpc-cni|eks-pod-identity-agent|aws-ebs-csi-driver|aws-efs-csi-driver|metrics-server)$' | wc -l || echo 0; done; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

aws eks list-clusters --query 'clusters[]' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read cluster; do [ -n "$cluster" ] && aws eks list-fargate-profiles --cluster-name "$cluster" --region $AWS_REGION --query 'length(fargateProfileNames)' --output text 2>/dev/null || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

aws eks list-clusters --query 'clusters[]' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read cluster; do [ -n "$cluster" ] && aws eks list-nodegroups --cluster-name "$cluster" --region $AWS_REGION --query 'length(nodegroups)' --output text 2>/dev/null || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

aws networkmanager describe-global-networks --region us-west-2 --query 'GlobalNetworks[].GlobalNetworkId' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read network; do [ -n "$network" ] && aws networkmanager get-transit-gateway-registrations --global-network-id "$network" --region us-west-2 --query 'length(TransitGatewayRegistrations)' --output text || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'

aws s3api list-buckets --query 'Buckets[].Name' --output text | tr '\t' '\n' | while read bucket; do [ -n "$bucket" ] && aws s3api get-bucket-policy --bucket "$bucket" >/dev/null 2>&1 && echo 1 || echo 0; done | awk '{s+=$1} END {print s}'
